question: Which among the following is correct about Blood Group B ?
option1: It has B antigen on its red cells and Anti A antigen in its plasma
option2: It has B antigen on its red cells and Anti B antigen in its plasma
option3: It has no antigens on its red cells but, anti A antigen in its plasma
option4: It has B antigen on its red cells but no antigen in its plasma
answer: It has B antigen on its red cells and Anti A antigen in its plasma
explanation: The red blood cells have both A and B antigens, but the plasma does not contain anti-A or anti-B antibodies. It has B antigen on its red cells and Anti A antigen in its plasma.
